member.summary: Options for .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketConnectionFactoryOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketConnectionFactoryOptions.IOQueueCount
member.summary: The number of I/O queues used to process requests. Set to 0 to directly schedule I/O to the ThreadPool.
member.remarks: Defaults to rounded down and clamped between 1 and 16.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketConnectionFactoryOptions.WaitForDataBeforeAllocatingBuffer
member.summary: Wait until there is data available to allocate a buffer. Setting this to false can increase throughput at the cost of increased memory usage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketConnectionFactoryOptions.MaxReadBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum unconsumed incoming bytes the transport will buffer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketConnectionFactoryOptions.MaxWriteBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum outgoing bytes the transport will buffer before applying write backpressure.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketConnectionFactoryOptions.UnsafePreferInlineScheduling
member.summary: Inline application and transport continuations instead of dispatching to the threadpool.
member.remarks: This will run application code on the IO thread which is why this is unsafe. It is recommended to set the DOTNET_SYSTEM_NET_SOCKETS_INLINE_COMPLETIONS environment variable to '1' when using this setting to also inline the completions at the runtime layer as well. This setting can make performance worse if there is expensive work that will end up holding onto the IO thread for longer than needed. Test to make sure this setting helps performance.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketTransportOptions
member.summary: Options for socket based transports.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketTransportOptions.IOQueueCount
member.summary: The number of I/O queues used to process requests. Set to 0 to directly schedule I/O to the ThreadPool.
member.remarks: Defaults to rounded down and clamped between 1 and 16.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketTransportOptions.WaitForDataBeforeAllocatingBuffer
member.summary: Wait until there is data available to allocate a buffer. Setting this to false can increase throughput at the cost of increased memory usage.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketTransportOptions.NoDelay
member.summary: Set to false to enable Nagle's algorithm for all connections.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketTransportOptions.Backlog
member.summary: The maximum length of the pending connection queue.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketTransportOptions.MaxReadBufferSize
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum unconsumed incoming bytes the transport will buffer.
A value of or 0 disables backpressure entirely allowing unlimited buffering. Unlimited server buffering is a security risk given untrusted clients.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketTransportOptions.MaxWriteBufferSize
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum outgoing bytes the transport will buffer before applying write backpressure.
A value of or 0 disables backpressure entirely allowing unlimited buffering. Unlimited server buffering is a security risk given untrusted clients.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketTransportOptions.UnsafePreferInlineScheduling
member.summary: Inline application and transport continuations instead of dispatching to the threadpool.
member.remarks: This will run application code on the IO thread which is why this is unsafe. It is recommended to set the DOTNET_SYSTEM_NET_SOCKETS_INLINE_COMPLETIONS environment variable to '1' when using this setting to also inline the completions at the runtime layer as well. This setting can make performance worse if there is expensive work that will end up holding onto the IO thread for longer than needed. Test to make sure this setting helps performance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Server.Kestrel.Transport.Sockets.SocketTransportOptions.CreateBoundListenSocket
member.summary: A function used to create a new to listen with. If not set, is used.
member.remarks: Implementors are expected to call on the . Please note that calls as part of its implementation, so implementors using this method do not need to call it again.

member.summary: Creates a default instance of for the given that can be used by a connection listener to listen for inbound requests. is called by this method.

member.name: T:System.Buffers.DiagnosticMemoryPool
member.summary: Used to allocate and distribute re-usable blocks of memory.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.DiagnosticMemoryPool.AnySize
member.summary: This default value passed in to Rent to use the default value for the pool.

member.name: T:System.Buffers.DiagnosticPoolBlock
member.summary: Block tracking object used by the byte buffer memory pool. A slab is a large allocation which is divided into smaller blocks. The individual blocks are then treated as independent array segments.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.DiagnosticPoolBlock._pool
member.summary: Back-reference to the memory pool which this block was allocated from. It may only be returned to this pool.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.DiagnosticPoolBlock.#ctor(System.Buffers.DiagnosticMemoryPool,System.Buffers.IMemoryOwner{System.Byte})
member.summary: This object cannot be instantiated outside of the static Create method

member.name: T:System.Buffers.MemoryPoolBlock
member.summary: Wraps an array allocated in the pinned object heap in a reusable block of managed memory

member.name: P:System.Buffers.MemoryPoolBlock.Pool
member.summary: Back-reference to the memory pool which this block was allocated from. It may only be returned to this pool.

member.name: T:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool
member.summary: Used to allocate and distribute re-usable blocks of memory.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool._blockSize
member.summary: The size of a block. 4096 is chosen because most operating systems use 4k pages.

member.name: P:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool.MaxBufferSize
member.summary: Max allocation block size for pooled blocks, larger values can be leased but they will be disposed after use rather than returned to the pool.

member.name: P:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool.BlockSize
member.summary: The size of a block. 4096 is chosen because most operating systems use 4k pages.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool._blocks
member.summary: Thread-safe collection of blocks which are currently in the pool. A slab will pre-allocate all of the block tracking objects and add them to this collection. When memory is requested it is taken from here first, and when it is returned it is re-added.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool._isDisposed
member.summary: This is part of implementing the IDisposable pattern.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool.AnySize
member.summary: This default value passed in to Rent to use the default value for the pool.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool.Return(System.Buffers.MemoryPoolBlock)
member.summary: Called to return a block to the pool. Once Return has been called the memory no longer belongs to the caller, and Very Bad Things will happen if the memory is read of modified subsequently. If a caller fails to call Return and the block tracking object is garbage collected, the block tracking object's finalizer will automatically re-create and return a new tracking object into the pool. This will only happen if there is a bug in the server, however it is necessary to avoid leaving "dead zones" in the slab due to lost block tracking objects.
member.param: The block to return. It must have been acquired by calling Lease on the same memory pool instance.

member.name: T:UnmanagedBufferAllocator
member.summary: Allocator that manages blocks of unmanaged memory.

member.name: P:UnmanagedBufferAllocator.DefaultBlockSize
member.summary: The default block size for the allocator.
member.remarks: This size assumes a common page size and provides an accommodation for the pointer chain used to track allocated blocks.

member.name: M:UnmanagedBufferAllocator.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Instantiate an instance.
member.param: The unmanaged memory block size in bytes.

member.name: M:UnmanagedBufferAllocator.AllocAsPointer``1(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocate the requested amount of space from the allocator.
member.returns: A pointer to the reserved memory.

member.name: M:UnmanagedBufferAllocator.AllocAsSpan``1(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocate the requested amount of space from the allocator.
member.returns: A Span to the reserved memory.

member.name: M:UnmanagedBufferAllocator.GetHeaderEncodedBytes(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Get pointer to bytes for the supplied string in UTF-8.
member.param: The length of the returned byte buffer.
member.returns: A pointer to the buffer of bytes
